They document their observations in a notebook, jotting down what they see, smell, and hear.
Agent A invites Agent B to observe the experiment and share the excitement of the color change.
Afterwards, they sanitize the table and wash their hands.
Agent A shows the completed experiment to Agent C and explains what they learned.

scenario: Agent A, a teen, is assembling an intricate model airplane kit in the living room. Agent B is birdwatching nearby, and Agent C is baking cookies in the kitchen. The environment is calm and quiet.

actions.description: Agent A reads through the model airplane instructions before beginning the assembly.
Agent A examines each piece closely and arranges them for assembly.
Agent A sets up an area to paint and decorate airplane parts.
Agent A uses a magnifying glass for smaller pieces.
Agent A takes a break to watch birds with Agent B.
Agent A shows progress to Agent B for color suggestions.
Agent A enjoys a cookie break.
Agent A plays thematic music to enhance assembly ambiance.
Agent A researches historical facts about the model airplane.

scenario: Agent A, a 14-year-old teenage enthusiast for ecology, is in his family's garden planning where to hang a newly constructed birdhouse, as his mother and grandfather engage in separate activities in the garden.

actions.description: Agent A researches on his phone for the best location to place a birdhouse to attract birds while ensuring it’s out of reach for predators.
Agent A invites his family to watch the first bird's arrival from a perfect viewing spot.
Agent A observes the birds discreetly with binoculars.
Agent A keeps a journal documenting visiting bird species.
Agent A takes photos, considering making a scrapbook or exhibition.
Agent A sketches designs of the birdhouse's interior.
Agent A reviews the birdhouse's structural integrity after a breezy afternoon.

scenario: In a spacious kitchen filled with the aroma of freshly baked cookies, Agent A is meticulously sorting through a recipe book brimming with untested exotic dishes.

actions.description: Agent A decides to bake a unique dessert from the recipe book using a combination of spices they have never tried before.
Agent A invites Agent B to join in the cooking process, turning it into a bonding activity.
Agent A sets up a camera to record the baking process for future reference and possible online sharing.
After baking, Agent A carefully tastes the dessert and takes notes on the flavor profile for improvements.
Agent A cleans up the kitchen space diligently, ensuring all sharp objects and hazards are securely stored.
Agent A and Agent B sit together to savor the freshly baked cookies, experiencing the warmth of the home atmosphere.
Agent A decides to prepare small packages of cookies for their neighbors, spreading the delight of their creation.

scenario: Agent A, a retired librarian with a deep love for literature, is examining an old family scrapbook in the living room. Agent B, her granddaughter, is sketching nearby while Agent C, the cat, sleeps in a sunlit spot. Agent A discovers a photograph with a mystery location, engaging her sense of remembrance and contentment.

actions.description: Agent A calls over Agent B to share the old photograph.
Agent A suggests they research the location online.
Agent A opens the window to let in more light.
Agent A reads from an old diary to Agent B.
Agent A goes into the attic for more related items.
Agent A plays a recording of family stories.
Agent A takes notes on discoveries with Agent B.
Agent A invites Agent B to create a new scrapbook.
